definitions.example: I want this done before Monday.
He performed before the troops in North Africa.
The case laid before the panel aroused nothing but ridicule.

definitions.definition: In store for, in the future of (someone).
In front of, according to a formal system of ordering items.
definitions.example: In alphabetical order, "cat" comes before "dog", "canine" before feline".

definitions.definition: At a higher or greater position than, in a ranking.
definitions.example: An entrepreneur puts market share and profit before quality, an amateur intrinsic qualities before economical considerations.

definitions.definition: In advance of the time when.

definitions.example: I'll die before I'll tell you anything about it.
